Key Match Events: Luka Doncic had 32 points, nine rebounds, and seven assists.
Daniel Gafford scored a season-high 18 points.
The Dallas Mavericks outscored the Orlando Magic 30-9 in the first 9:30 of the second quarter.
Franz Wagner led the Magic with 13 points.
Dereck Lively II had 11 points and 11 rebounds off Dallas’ bench.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Orlando played its second game without Paolo Banchero, who suffered a torn right oblique.
Wendell Carter Jr. was limited to nine first-half minutes, six points, and a rebound because of a strain of his left plantar fascia.
Orlando was outscored 52-36 in the paint and had a season-worst 19.5% on 3-pointers (8 of 41).
The Mavericks outscored the Magic 13-2 in the final 3:10 of the first quarter.
Dallas outscored Orlando 19-12 in fast-break points and finished with a season-high 53 rebounds.
